answers.answer: You're smart to be so observant and concerned. It cannot hurt to share your concern with the little girl's mother. The child's pediatrician can do a quick blood-sugar test and see if there is any reason for concern. Thirst and frequent urination are the most common symptoms, so it's worth checking them out.

question: I have a 3 1/2 year old girl that I watch 5 days a week.  She is very large for her age, so I don't think she is losing weight.  However, she is excessively thirsty and has to go to the bathroom quite often.  She is a very good eater.  Maybe too good!  She is a very happy little girl.  I'm not sure if I should mention to her mom that she might want to have her tested for diabetes? What do you all think?  Thanks for your insight!
title: daycare child--possible diabetes??
